page.title: 16Historical Interest
page.content:
Thomas Carlyle and Jane Welsh
Jane Welsh, niece of the Rev. Walter Welsh, minister of the Parish of Auchtertool, fell in love with the rising historian and essayist Thomas Carlyle. For five years they did much of their courting at the manse in Auchtertool (Old Schoolhouse). In 1826 they married and from then until her death in 1866, Jane and her husband returned every summer to holiday in Auchtertool. From letters written by Mrs Carlyle it would seem in spite of their strong mutual affection, their marriage was full of quarrels and misunderstandings. Often Mrs Carlyle turned up at her Uncles manse in need of comfort and rest. It must have been very difficult to live with such a calvanistic, imperious man.
